title: Facebook executive defends company’s approach to doctored Pelosi video: ‘We have acted’
text: That’s Facebook’s head of global policy management, Monika Bickert, defending on CNN the company’s approach to the posting and sharing on its platform of perniciously manipulated video footage of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi.

title: FANG stocks in correction as trade tensions hit tech
text: FANG stocks are in correction as trade tensions hit tech.

title: Facebook settlement delayed by FTC split: Dow Jones
text: CNBC's Julia Boorstin reports on a Dow Jones report that the Facebook settlement has been delayed because of an FTC split.

title: Buy Facebook And AMD When They Are Cheap
text: It's times like this when stocks are cheapest because the fear has taken the optimism out of prices. Investors who overcome their fears can make their best buys at these times.

title: Zuckerberg should hire a new CEO: Former Facebook security chief
text: Alex Stamos, former Facebook chief security officer, joins 'The Exchange' to discuss whether Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg should hire a new CEO for the company.

title: FAANG leads Tech Rebound
text: Steve Milunovich, Wolfe Research managing director, and Brent Thill, equity analyst at Jefferies, join CNBC's "Squawk Alley" team to discuss FAANG stocks and their performance in the market.

title: Facebook Stock Is Still a Buy Despite China Risk
text: Facebook is arguing that the government shouldn't split it up due to China concerns. But spinoffs could be just the right medicine for FB stock.

title: Facebook Battles the Fake Account Robots Part 3
text: The social networking giant has released its third Community Standards Enforcement report, which showed a massive spike in automated fake account registrations.

title: Zuckerberg reportedly held talks with Winklevoss twins about Facebook's cryptocurrency plans
text: Facebook's founder Mark Zuckerberg has had talks with the Winklevoss twins about the social media giant's developing digital currency.

title: Facebook (FB) Down 6.4% Since Last Earnings Report: Can It Rebound?
text: Facebook (FB) reported earnings 30 days ago. What's next for the stock?

title: Facebook expert says breaking up the company won't work
text: Facebook co-founder Chris Hughes called for the break-up of the social media networking giant in a New York Times op-ed.

title: Ex-Facebook privacy chief: Breaking up the social network won't lead to better data protection
text: Breaking up the social network won't lead to better data protection, said former Facebook executive Chris Kelly.

title: Facebook Is Tackling Fake Accounts at a Global Level, VP Bickert Says
text: Monika Bickert, Facebook Inc. vice president of global policy management, discusses the social media company's efforts to remove fake accounts with Bloomberg's Emily Chang on "Bloomberg Technology."

title: Facebook Removes More Fake Accounts, Says It's Improving Violation Detections
text: Facebook Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) said Thursday it prevented or removed more than 2 billion fake accounts in the first quarter as it works to regain public confidence after criticism about spreading false news.

title: Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg says company does not have dominant market position
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg responds to calls to break-up the company.

title: Facebook Cleans House: Over 3 Billion Fake Accounts Gone
text: Facebook Inc. has announced that it removed over 3 billion fake accounts from its platform between October 2018 and March 2019.

title: Facebook nearly doubled the number of fake accounts it took down last quarter
text: Facebook also says it's reacting faster to illicit sales of drugs and firearms.

title: Hit Like on FB Stock Now — It Could Rally 20%
text: The Facebook chart presents a realistic 20% rally opportunity where the downside risk is much smaller than the upside reward.

title: Facebook releases community standards enforcement report
text: Facebook has just released its latest community standards enforcement report and the verdict is in: people are awful, and happy to share how awful they are with the world.

title: Facebook reportedly considered backing out of political ad sales, but Zuckerberg ruled against it
text: Facebook has stopped paying commission to staff for selling political advertisements on its platform, The Wall Street Journal reported.

title: Facebook ends commissions for political ad sales
text: The "Squawk Box" crew talk about several of the morning's top stories.

title: Virtual Reality's Next Generation Device Is Here
text: The Oculus Quest has arrived, and it's a big step forward for home VR users looking for an affordable entry point.

title: Oculus co-founder: 'I got fired' from Facebook for 'no reason at all'
text: Oculus co-founder told CNBC that he "got fired" from Facebook for "for no reason at all"

title: Cannabis Still Can't Be Sold, Promoted On Facebook Or Instagram
text: Cannabis has gained mainstream acceptance in recent years, but it's still federally banned in the U.S.

title: Don’t Worry About Facebook Stock… Yet
text: FB stock is still one of the best social media stocks out there and well remain so as long as user growth and engagement persists.

title: Cannabis Watch: Facebook still will not allow marijuana sales on its platform
text: After roughly three months of internal and external deliberations, Facebook Inc. decided Tuesday to continue attempting to block the sale of marijuana on its platform.

title: Facebook’s Oculus could be the superhero comic books need to crack virtual reality
text: Facebook's latest virtual reality (VR) device, called Oculus Quest, gets good reviews.

title: Indonesia restricts WhatsApp and Instagram usage following deadly riots
text: Indonesia is the latest nation to hit the hammer on social media after the government restricted the use of WhatsApp  and Instagram following deadly riots yesterday.

title: TikTok parent launches new messaging service challenging Snapchat and Facebook
text: TikTok's owner has launched a new messaging service that could pose a threat to Facebook and Snapchat.

title: Facebook's ex-security chief says Mark Zuckerberg should hire a new CEO
text: Former Facebook executive Alex Stamos said Mark Zuckerberg should hire a new CEO and turn his focus to building products.

title: Facebook: Astonishing And Frustrating
text: Why Facebook is akin to a toll bridge. Ultimately, Facebook's platforms are healthy and growing.

title: What does ‘regulating Facebook’ mean? Here’s an example
text: Many officials claim that governments should regulate Facebook and other social platforms, but few describe what it actually means. A few days ago, France released a report that outlines what France — and maybe the European Union — plans to do when it comes to content moderation.

title: Our Top Pick Facebook Is Still An Extraordinary GARP Stock
text: Facebook shares have fallen alongside the broader market on U.S. trade policy tensions.

title: Facebook still a great place to amplify pre-election junk news, EU study finds
text: A study carried out by academics at Oxford University to investigate how junk news is being shared on social media in Europe ahead of regional elections this month has found individual stories shared on Facebook’s platform can still hugely outperform the most important and professionally produced news stories.

title: Oculus Quest and Rift S now shipping
text: Facebook -owned Oculus is shipping its latest VR headgear from today. Preorders for the PC-free Oculus Quest and the higher end Oculus Rift S opened up three weeks ago.

title: Millions of Instagram influencers had their contact data scraped and exposed
text: A massive database containing contact information of millions of Instagram celebrities and its most valuable users has been found online. The database, hosted by Amazon Web Services, was left exposed and without a password allowing anyone to look inside.

title: Facebook releases a trio of maps to aid with fighting disease outbreaks
text: Facebook this morning announced a new initiative focused on using its data and technologies to help nonprofit organizations and universities working in public health better map the spread of infectious diseases around the world. Specifically, the company is introducing three new maps: population density maps with demographic estimates, movement maps, and network coverage maps.

title: Facebook VP: Asking myself this simple question on Monday makes me more productive all week long
text: Julie Zhuo says this little habit has made her more efficient and a better manager.

title: Facebook’s latest account purge exposes Africa’s misinformation problem
text: Facebook last week purged a network of hundreds of pages, groups and Instagram accounts it labeled as producing “coordinated inauthentic behavior” toward Africa. The activity originated in Israel and was largely targeted toward Nigeria, Senegal, Togo, Angola, Niger, and Tunisia.
